intro: Puccinellia laxa, commonly known as slender needlegrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to temperate regions of Asia and is often found in wet meadows, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has slender, erect stems that are often branched, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain tiny, two-lobed flowers. Puccinellia laxa is adapted to moist environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland habitats.
